author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 60-year-old patient died in the septic ward of Government Vellore Medical College Hospital (GVMCH) on Thursday night. While hospital authorities said the cause of death is yet to be ascertained, police said he committed suicide by hanging.

Pain in the leg

Annadurai, a resident of L.G.Pudur, Karasamangalam post in Katpadi taluk was admitted to the ward after he complained of severe pain in his left leg. His right leg was amputated six months ago in a Bengaluru hospital, hospital authorities said.

"He underwent amputation probably due to diabetes. He had come to the casualty at 5.45 a.m. on Thursday owing to severe pain on the left leg. He was admitted to the ward and was treated for septic shock," a hospital authority said.

The male nurse had gone to the next ward to attend to patients, when Annadurai’s wife Kanaga (54) called for help. Annadurai was found on the ground, he said.

“His pulse and blood pressure was down. The doctors rushed in but could he could not be revived despite efforts,” he added.

A post-mortem was conducted, and the body was handed over to the family. “The cause of death will be known only after the report arrives,” he said.

However, Vellore Taluk police, who have registered a case of suspicious death, said Annadurai was suffering from cancer and had committed suicide when his wife had gone to the bathroom at about 9.15 p.m.

Police said he hanged himself using a bandage by tying it to the bed.

People in need of counselling can contact the State Health Department’s round-the-clock helpline – 104. Chennai-based Sneha suicide prevention centre can be contacted at 044-24640050.
title: Patient dies at GH, police say he committed suicide
